docs.snippet: ASPINALL--Anne. The Hampton Classic Horse Show mourns the passing of Anne Aspinall, long-time Board member and one of the Classic's founders, on February 16 after a long battle with cancer. A leading figure at the Topping Riding Club, Anne was one...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASPINALL--Anne. The Hampton Classic Horse Show mourns the passing of Anne Aspinall, long-time Board member and one of the Classic's founders, on February 16 after a long battle with cancer. A leading figure at the Topping Riding Club, Anne was one of Long Island's most respected hunter-jumper trainers. She received the Hampton Classic's inaugural Long Island Sportsmanship Award in 2007 for her exemplary sportsmanship and more than 35 years of service to the Long Island Hunter-Jumper industry. Anne is survived by her sister, Emily. A memorial service will be held this spring. Donations may be made to Fighting Chance or the Peconic Land Trust.

docs.snippet: BECKER--George Everett, died February 1, 2012 in Portland, TN. Born January 6, 1934, Hackensack, NJ. Father was owner/chef at Woodlawn Station subway terminal restaurant. George was a Bronx PS 80 student, US Navy man, Computer programmer, Lumber j...
docs.lead_paragraph: BECKER--George Everett, died February 1, 2012 in Portland, TN. Born January 6, 1934, Hackensack, NJ. Father was owner/chef at Woodlawn Station subway terminal restaurant. George was a Bronx PS 80 student, US Navy man, Computer programmer, Lumber jack, Business owner, Draftsman, Carpenter, Competitive diver, Author. Preceded in death by son, Scott. Survived by wife, Carol; sisters Doris Purchase, Port St. Lucie, FL; Barbara Gee, Barefoot Bay, FL; daughter Lynne Bragan, Birmingham, AL; sons Todd Becker, San Jose, CA; Eric Becker, Santa Clarita, CA; Brad Paulding, Dongola, IL; Steve Paulding, San Jose, CA. He will be missed.

docs.snippet: Charlie Chaplin's silence, it seems, may run deeper than that he enacted on the silver screen, according to documents released on Friday by the British spy agency MI5, Reuters reported.     The documents, based on an investigation begun in 1952 in...
docs.abstract: British intelligence agency MI5 releases documents from a 1952 investigation of Charlie Chaplin revealing that the agency could find no record of his birth nor any evidence to support the notion, floated by the FBI, that he was a dangerous Communist sympathizer who was really named Israel Thornstein. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Charlie Chaplin's silence, it seems, may run deeper than that he enacted on the silver screen, according to documents released on Friday by the British spy agency MI5, Reuters reported. The documents, based on an investigation begun in 1952 in response to F.B.I. claims that Chaplin was a dangerous Communist sympathizer, could find no record of his birth, nor any evidence to support the notion, floated by the F.B.I, that he was using an alias and was really named Israel Thornstein.
